title: Update on Fps Issues in 7.22 and 7.23
body:
We're aware that some of you are experiencing FPS issues since 7.22 and we are actively working on finding a solution. Sorry for the pain this is causing everyone :( Playing a game that's super laggy is not fun and you should be losing games cuz you suck, not cuz we suck. 

These types of issues are really hard to track down because there are so many different variables with PC machines and we don't have a reproduction case in-game. Note, if anyone has one please send it my way! (videos you have or any patterns you see help a lot!) We're identifying things that aren't performing optimally and fixing those and we're hoping it'll catch the actual problem you're all seeing. Reality is that right now it's a guessing game.

For the long-term, we've been adding better tools and processes for monitoring in-game performance so we can catch issues right when they go in instead of trying to work our way through weeks of changes to identify the cause.

Thanks for the patience while we figure out what the real issue is. We're trying to get this fixed as soon as we can! AND PLEASE, if you have any reproduction cases send them my way!

replies.body:
1080 ti, 8700k drop to 100 fps in teamfights, great programming you guys have there.

I dont understand why this game in general wont make use of powerful hardware, my GPU utilization is like 20% max. I get more FPS in actually demanding games like Battlefield 1 and Overwatch than this game.

 You're a billion dollar company, how are you unable to code this game to make better use of hardware? Pretty sad honestly whats the excuse?

This is a great question! On other game development projects, I've spent months optimizing performance on every little scene and area of the game. We polished those areas and then never had to touch them again because nothing ever changed. If we ever released DLC it was self-contained and we would again spend months optimizing it. 

League is different. The game is always a work in progress and we're adding and changing stuff all the time. We only have a few weeks to test our changes and stuff like this can creep in if we're not hyper aware of it. You're right that we need to do a better job and it's why we're investing in better tools and processes to catch this earlier. 

We're not meeting expectations for what you expect from a competitive PC game and we're gonna do whatever we need to do to fix that. Thanks for calling us out on it. It gives me more of a drive to get this fixed as soon as we can!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

The main issue just feels like input lag and delay. 

It feels like I'm playing with turn rates, and the game will just randomly ignore input and attack commands despite having completely stable ping.
Interesting, do you have videos by any chance?
This feels like the exact same problem I've been having, I'll try to record some of my gameplay if I get a chance to play tonight

My bots have had less fps since preseason patch came in. Dropped performance by 25% at least. 

P.S. When can we expect banwave?

As many others have already said,the issue started since 7.24b. Disabling the Snowdown map has not helped,neither closing the client during the game. I also performed a clean boot but the issue persists. Still waiting for an update...
it's kind of anoying that it has not come to at least a perspective or some list of possible solutions, its pretty much impossible to play rn.

After the 7.24 patch and also windows 10 update to 1709  i have this issues with my fps in League i had before all this updates i had 120 fps when the game start and all the match my fps was like 70-80 now i`m having in the start of the game only 70 fps and after the minions have spawned i have 30-40 fps...{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

[SOLVED]

So, guys, i've been having this problem for over 2 years now. I've been playin on my macbook pro (6years old). Yesterday the HDD broke, and today i installed an SSD. Same mac, same processor, just with a SSD. It goes good, it doesn't do that anymore.

cons: 250Gb for 100€ ...

horray!

> [{quoted}](name=Jocox,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=lZv6E2Xz,comment-id=003b,timestamp=2017-12-08T21:05:08.236+0000)
>
> [SOLVED]
> 
> So, guys, i've been having this problem for over 2 years now. I've been playin on my macbook pro (6years old). Yesterday the HDD broke, and today i installed an SSD. Same mac, same processor, just with a SSD. It goes good, it doesn't do that anymore.
> 
> cons: 250Gb for 100€ ...
> 
> horray!

I'm playing on an SSD still have this issue.
Triggered. Team game, matches aren't lost because one person sucks.
I wanna give you every advantage I can so you can carry me <3
Riot JannaXEve huh? Raunchy.

I used to get 150 or something early and around 50-40 at least during endgame and fights. Now I still get 150 on start, but really fast it drops down to 60 which is playable, but eventually during actual lategame it microfreezes a lot and fps consistently dives under 50 and eventually less. Then in teamfights it goes to like 30-20 and less. Definitely started with preseason, I remember I had it during PBE as well, but thought that was just because its the PBE. 

My best guess is some rune interaction if no engine changes were made at all in the preseason patches.

Edit: this definitely seems like an issue that is cpu focused as that is my main bottleneck: alright mobile gpu that can run most games at same fps regardless of most graphics settings paired with a shitty cpu that makes sure my frames are garbage no matter what. I dont think these frame drops would be happening to me if it was gpu related - I can set my game to high or low without much difference in frames at all.
We're thinking it's CPU related as well, digging into what may be causing it

Heya JxE,

Look into Windows 10 builds on older chipsets. I run an i& 3770 Ivy Bridge in Windows 10 with a GTX 1070 and get hitching every 15-30 seconds or so. In full screen it manifests as a large frame skip that still responds to movement and skill keys, but in borderless it happens as a large frame drops to sub 30fps which gradually climbs back up, or goes away of you alt+tab out then back in again. Sounds a lot like a Window manager issue for Win10, but instead I think you might be right about CPU/chipset. My alt comp with an i7 4770 w/ GTX 1050Ti doesn't have the issue at all (HP Elitedesk 800 G2 tower). Just some ammo for the issue if you need it. Thanks.

I usually start the game with around 230-240 fps, dropping down to 130-170 in the first 10 min, after that in the next 20 mins, it gets to around 80 FPS, and later on I experience teamfights with less than 40 FPS sometimes.

Specs:
I7-7770HQ
GTX-1050Ti
8 DDR-4 GB RAM

JxE, u have any updates on the situation? they are working on smth? we want to know at least if they are working on it. It seems we're a lot with these problems, so please keep us updated, what's happening?
yeah lag always when loggin laggggggggggggggggggggggggggg patch 7.23 laaaagggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggg
I seem to notice whenever there is a team fight in bases. All the minions spawning and grouping crash my fps sometimes. It sucks cause I'm trying to team fight{{summoner:11}} .

I'm not saying it directly caused it, however:

there was a Windows 10 update this patch,
which could be a source for some of the problems.

For example, I had to disable fullscreen optimizations through League's file manager this patch to stop my mouse from acting funny.
We'll definitely look into that, thanks for the idea!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot JxE,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=lZv6E2Xz,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-11-28T06:38:27.175+0000)

Should we send in a ticket with info if we're having these issues? I'm getting massive FPS drops, but I'm playing on a pretty much brand new computer with quite a bit of memory.
For now, just letting me know here is the best thing

>

Are we going to be getting an update on these issues any time soon?
Been wanting to play the new season but the fps is unbearable.
Fps starts normally but drops over time as the game goes on. been like this for me since the new season started and every other game seems to work perfectly.

any new information? still laggy as fuck. i have steady ms. already talked to a riot support dude named Corndog a month ago who had a minor solution that helped a bit. this has been going on for like 2 months. i think we deserve a real fix. here is what i was told to do https://i.imgur.com/iQOPk0E.png {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

After investigating myself on the issue i have discovered an potentially interesting bond between the client and the problem with having performance issues.

Beside everything i tried the only thing that worked out for me was to close the client during game and enable VSync to get a smooth Framerate without tearing and insane dropping after some minutes of gametime.

I would highly recommend for you guys and @RiotJxE to check your ingame connections of the client because most likely imo there you will find the cause of the problem. (This is even the most logical, because "big" changes where made only to the client infrastructure)

I hope this will lead to success {{champion:107}} {{item:3147}}  :D
Any updates? I can't play this game anymore, I had 0 lag issues until patch 7.23 :(
I'm running the mac client, usually get 80-120 fps but starting a patch or two ago I'm getting more like 25. Happens every game, FPS drops about 30 seconds after loading in.

I have been having this issue since the new patch.  The thing is that during the game the FPS won't drop but I still can't move for 2-5 secs.  After I am be able to move, I see the FPS drops down from 120-130 ish to 80-90 and it goes back up again.  I hope you guys will be able to find out what's going on soon.  I do have some replays but dunno how to add it on.  If you do know, please let me know so I can let you see what sort of the issues I have during the game play.  Thanks!
That sounds like network issues to me. A video will help confirm for sure though
Is it possible to get some sort of update? Thanks.

Can Rioters please give an update on the situation? It's been 3 patches so far and I still have the same input lag and frame drop issues. This last patch seems to have dealt slightly with some stuttering but otherwise it's exactly the same.

**Things I've tried:**
1. Hextech Repair tool
2. Reinstalling the game
3. Reinstalling the game on windows 7 on a separate non-SSD partition
4. Clearing my persistedsettings and other configs as per a rioters instructions
5. Underclocking my CPU and Graphics card
6. Overclocking my CPU, graphics card, and ram
7. Bootable memtest for ram
8. Locked FPS, Unlocked FPS, and a variety of in-game setting changes as per the Riot Support FPS troubleshooting
9. Disabling Hyperthreading
10. Client performance mode and closing while in-game
11. Playing the game on a comparable computer
12. Disabling optimizations in the client compatibility tab

I'm going a bit insane here. 

**PC Specs:**
CPU - Ryzen 1600 @ stock
GPU - MSI RX 480 @ stock
RAM - Patriot Viper 3200mhz 
Motherboard - MSI B350 Carbon Pro
Drive - Samsung 850 EVO 250GB
144hz monitor

Something interesting happened yesterday. I was playing against a Nocturne and when the screen went dark my FPS went *up* from ~130 into the 200s. Then as soon as the screen was revealed again it went down. 
I played a bunch of games on 7.24 and I'm still not having FPS drops into the 40s like before. For the most part I'm hovering around 130.
Did you guys silently roll out a fix this patch? Seems to me that things are working better today.
My fps was fine,now this patch lowered my fps, lmao.{{champion:122}}

Idk if that can help but I usually check my performances in game by going into a custom game (when I change drivers for example) and I can notice that the longer the game goes the less fps I get BUT I litteraly don't do anything, I spawn on the rift and I don't even move the camera, I just close the tip on the right and that's all. First I get like 250-270 fps, then minion spawn and it lowers a bit and when the second wave spawn I go down to 150 and 200 fps once minions aren't on screen anymore. But at that point there shouldn't be more "things" on the map at once since there is already 2 waves of creeps alive, and still the fps goes down every wave even if it's just a bit. So even tho I don't actually know how it works I wonder if minions are still loaded even after their death. 
Also between spawn and lane there is almost a 200 fps difference (270->100) and I know that a lot more things are loaded on lane and in real game but, I feel like it's not supposed to drop fps by THAT much, if I can have more than 250 fps by looking anywhere on the map why are 1 champion and 5 creeps all it takes to divide fps by 2 ? Ok maybe we actually load everything even if we don't look at it but still I don't see why champions and units reduce fps by that much when it feels like the summoner's rift might be way harder to load actually. But maybe that's really the way it's supposed to work idk.

Also since fps drop a lot in lane too even in custom games I think it's not a special case about teamfight anomation and so on but something really basic either about the map or minions or champions or timers...

Isn't it possible to see what does the render in a console with logs or something like that ? If not is it possible to create a tool to do it ? (Maybe it would reduce performance but its only purpose would be for you to see if there are loops or compare it with old patchs or things that goes wrong in the way the game render) that way even if it takes time to build it you will always have an easier time to fix things in the future.

My pc specs : windows 10 64 bits
Nvidia 960m 4gb vram latest driver atm something like 388.43 I believe, I7 4720hq, playing on SSD. My performances on other games didn't reduce for years and I take care of my pc so I sure know the issues aren't on my end :/

It also takes (just a bit) longer to load the game in comparison with 2 years ago for example, even with a fresh windows installation, fresh lol installation, same ssd and defragmentation (dunno how it's said in english) so maybe it's not about the renderer but something that already happen while the game load.

Anyway I threw a lot of random idea and maybe that's just useless but hey it's a guessing game after all
Since Patch 7.22 and 7.23 my fps has been, no joke, 4-8 fps. Literally impossible to play with, will this be fixed sometime soon?
Working on it! 4-8 fps is really bad though, what was it before?

Hi there JxE! 

Just wanted to let you know what kind of problems I've been experienced. 
Game runs smooth for the first 25-28 minutes with 120 FPS, by settings. Then after 25-28 minutes ingame, FPS drops straight down to 50-60 FPS. When entering a teamfight, FPS drops down to 15-30 FPS.

Tried to run a repair, reinstalling, updated all drivers. Even reinstalled my whole system including windows 10. Problem still happens. Here's my specs:

- Intel Core i7 4770k @ 3.50GHz
- 16GB DDR3 RAM
- NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080
- 232GB Samsung SSD

When i spawn in fountain I have 250 plus FPS and it stays above 144 for the first 5 minutes of the game. After around 25-30 min, I am at a constant 80 FPS and it drops under 60 in late game team fights. For some people this might not seem like an issue, but playing on a 144hz monitor this is frustrating (I am also playing on the lowest possible settings with a 1050 ti and an AMD FX 8320). I play Overwatch on the highest settings at a constant 150 FPS. No way I should be getting this much lower on League of Legends.

I'm fairly certain it's related to the client in the background.  For me the random lag started after the new client came out.  I don't know or understand why this would be related to teamfights, but it definitely is.  problem has existed even before the rune changes.  I personally get fps to hit caps easily but then during teamfights (even if i'm not even present in them sometimes) it will drop to as low as < 10fps sometimes.  I know there is an option to disable it while the game is being played, but when checking task manager during lag, the process still exists and is eating up cpu.  Force closing it seems to help, but then I have to log in again after every match.  However I don't think this is everything, and randomly guessing as a programmer myself, I would think it's related to the fact that there are 3-5 processes related to league running at once for some reason.  Honestly the client itself using over a gig of ram is kind of ridiculous when not in a match, everything it does could be handled as simple html5 with local assets.  it's just text and pictures

on the flipside being cautious of this lag has made mejai's stacks easier to retain.

Hey,

my Problems appeared right after the Plant Patch ... since then every Game when the Plants spawn my Screen freezes for half a second - second.
Most problems also appear after the Elder dragon has Spawned and will get worse after he has been slain! (If he Spawns from around 130-140fps to max. 90fps .. after he has been slain most of the time like 60-80 fps..) 

The Problem is that the FPS change dramatically from like 100 to 70 to 110 in like 1-2 seconds...

I can remember that 2 or 3 Patches ago the Problems were significantly reduced.. atleast until min 30+!


My PC:

Ryzen 1700x
Asus Strix GTX 1080 Ti
16 GB DDR4 2133Mhz
M.2 SSD

Had the Problem on 2 PC builds.. will test it in like 3 days with the 3rd one.
Drivers always up 2 date and a clean Windows installation.

Experiencing the same problem in pretty much every game. Some games are worse than others. I used to have over 200 FPS and now my best seems to be about 150 and it's sometimes dropping to 30 in teamfights. For an example, on one of my recent streams, just pick a random time like the ten minute period between 01:40:00 to 01:50:00 and watch the variability in my FPS... randomly jumping around between 60 and 120: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/204762999
What do you mean it cant be reproduced? Just go fight with 4+ people on screen casting spells and you see fps drop like crazy ... easy as that!
